definitions.definition: a flattened structure of a higher plant, typically green and bladelike, that is attached to a stem directly or via a stalk. Leaves are the main organs of photosynthesis and transpiration.
examples: leaflet, frond, blade, needle; Morecotyledon, blade, bract "sycamore leaves"Morecotyledon, blade, bract sycamore leaves

definitions.definition: any of a number of plant structures similar to leaves, e.g., bracts, sepals, and petals.
examples: leaflet, frond, blade, needle; Morecotyledon, blade, bract "sycamore leaves"Morecotyledon, blade, bract sycamore leaves
the trees are still in leaf

definitions.definition: the leaves of tobacco or tea.
a thing that resembles a leaf in being flat and thin, typically something that is one of two or more similar items forming a set or stack.
a single thickness of paper, especially in a book with each side forming a page.
examples: page, sheet, folio a leaf in a book

definitions.definition: gold, silver, or other specified metal in the form of very thin foil.
the hinged part or flap of a door, shutter, or table.
an extra section inserted to extend a table.
the inner or outer part of a cavity wall or double-glazed window.
any of the stacked metal strips that form a leaf spring.
(of a plant, especially a deciduous one in spring) put out new leaves.
turn over (the pages of a book or the papers in a pile), reading them quickly or casually.
examples: he leafed through the stack of notes
